source_note: Estimated; inference minimal as few production AI deployments existed
Estimated; early GPT-2/BERT deployments beginning; training dominated
Estimated; GPT-3 era; training compute growing fast; inference starting to scale
Estimated; broader AI deployment in search/recommendations; still training-heavy
Deloitte/industry estimates; ChatGPT launch late 2022 drove inference demand spike
Deloitte; inference ~1/3 of all compute; training still majority of resources
Industry estimates; AI 2027/SemiAnalysis data; leading AI company training ~40% of internal compute
Deloitte; inference reaches parity with training; AI cloud inference spending $9.2B
Deloitte projected; inference dominates; AI cloud inference spending $20.6B (55% of $37.5B)
Projected; AI 2027 forecast shows leading company training drops to 20% of internal compute
Projected; continued shift as deployed AI agents/applications scale
Projected extrapolation; reasoning/agent workloads drive inference
Various projections (McKinsey/MarketsandMarkets); ~70% of DC demand from inferencing; training still grows in absolute terms
